segment.source: Create provisioning packages (Surface Hub)
segment.target: Create provisioning packages (Surface Hub)

segment.source: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.
segment.target: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.

segment.source: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.
segment.target: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.

segment.source: Create provisioning packages (Surface Hub)
segment.target: Create provisioning packages (Surface Hub)

segment.source: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.
segment.target: For Windows 10, settings that use the registry or a content services platform (CSP) can be configured using provisioning packages.

segment.source: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.
segment.target: You can also add certificates during first run using provisioning.

segment.source: In this topic, you'll find the following information:
segment.target: In this topic, you'll find the following information:

segment.source: Introduction to provisioning packages
segment.target: Introduction to provisioning packages

segment.source: What can provisioning packages configure for Microsoft Surface Hubs?
segment.target: What can provisioning packages configure for Microsoft Surface Hubs?

segment.source: How do I create and deploy a provisioning package?
segment.target: How do I create and deploy a provisioning package?

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: Install the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer
segment.target: Install the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer

segment.source: Create a provisioning package for certificates
segment.target: Create a provisioning package for certificates

segment.target: Create a provisioning package for apps

segment.source: Deploy a provisioning package to a Surface Hub
segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package to a Surface Hub

segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package using first run

segment.source: Deploy a provisioning package using Settings
segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package using Settings

segment.source: Introduction to provisioning packages
segment.target: Introduction to provisioning packages

segment.source: Provisioning packages are created using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (WICD), which is a part of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK).
segment.target: Provisioning packages are created using Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (WICD), which is a part of the Windows Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK).

segment.source: For Surface Hub, the provisioning packages can be placed on a USB drive.
segment.target: For Surface Hub, the provisioning packages can be placed on a USB drive.

segment.source: What can provisioning packages configure for Surface Hubs?
segment.target: What can provisioning packages configure for Surface Hubs?

segment.source: Currently, you can use provisioning packages to install certificates and to install Universal App Platform (UAP) apps on your Surface Hub.
segment.target: Currently, you can use provisioning packages to install certificates and to install Universal App Platform (UAP) apps on your Surface Hub.

segment.source: These are the only two supported scenarios.
segment.target: These are the only two supported scenarios.

segment.source: You may use provisioning packages to install certificates that will allow the device to authenticate to Microsoft Exchange or Skype for Business, or to sideload apps that don't come from the Windows Store (for example, your own in-house apps).
segment.target: You may use provisioning packages to install certificates that will allow the device to authenticate to Microsoft Exchange or Skype for Business, or to sideload apps that don't come from the Windows Store (for example, your own in-house apps).

segment.source: Note Provisioning can only install certificates to the device (local machine) store, and not to the user store.
segment.target: Note Provisioning can only install certificates to the device (local machine) store, and not to the user store.

segment.source: If your organization requires that certificates must be installed to the user store, you must use Mobile Device Management (MDM) to deploy these certificates.
segment.target: If your organization requires that certificates must be installed to the user store, you must use Mobile Device Management (MDM) to deploy these certificates.

segment.source: See your MDM solution documentation for details.
segment.target: See your MDM solution documentation for details.

segment.source: How do I create and deploy a provisioning package?
segment.target: How do I create and deploy a provisioning package?

segment.source: Provisioning packages must be created using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).
segment.target: Provisioning packages must be created using the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD).

segment.source: Requirements
segment.target: Requirements

segment.source: In order to create and deploy provisioning packages, all of the following are required:
segment.target: In order to create and deploy provisioning packages, all of the following are required:

segment.source: Access to the Settings app on Surface Hub (using admin credentials which were configured at initial setup of the Surface Hub).
segment.target: Access to the Settings app on Surface Hub (using admin credentials which were configured at initial setup of the Surface Hub).

segment.source: Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), which is installed as a part of the windows 10 Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK).
segment.target: Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD), which is installed as a part of the windows 10 Assessment and Deployment Kit (ADK).

segment.source: A PC running Windows 10.
segment.target: A PC running Windows 10.

segment.source: USB flash drive.
segment.target: USB flash drive.

segment.source: Install the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer
segment.target: Install the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer

segment.source: The Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) is installed as part of the Windows 10 ADK.
segment.target: The Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (ICD) is installed as part of the Windows 10 ADK.

segment.source: The installer for the ADK can be downloaded from the Microsoft Download Center.
segment.target: The installer for the ADK can be downloaded from the Microsoft Download Center.

segment.source: Note The ADK must be installed on a separate PC, not on the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Note The ADK must be installed on a separate PC, not on the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Run the installer, and set your preferences for installation.
segment.target: Run the installer, and set your preferences for installation.

segment.source: When asked what features you want to install, you will see a checklist like the one in the following figure.
segment.target: When asked what features you want to install, you will see a checklist like the one in the following figure.

segment.source: Note that Windows Performance Toolkit and Windows Assessment Toolkit should be unchecked, as they are not needed to run the ICD.
segment.target: Note that Windows Performance Toolkit and Windows Assessment Toolkit should be unchecked, as they are not needed to run the ICD.

segment.source: Before going to the next step, make sure you have the following checked:
segment.target: Before going to the next step, make sure you have the following checked:

segment.source: Deployment Tools
segment.target: Deployment Tools

segment.source: Windows Preinstallation Environment
segment.target: Windows Preinstallation Environment

segment.source: Imaging and Configuration Designer
segment.target: Imaging and Configuration Designer

segment.source: User State Migration Tool
segment.target: User State Migration Tool

segment.source: All four of these features are required to run the ICD and create a package for the Surfact Hub.
segment.target: All four of these features are required to run the ICD and create a package for the Surfact Hub.

segment.source: icd options checklist
segment.target: icd options checklist

segment.source: Continue with the installer until the ADK is installed.
segment.target: Continue with the installer until the ADK is installed.

segment.source: This may take a while, because the installer downloads remote content.
segment.target: This may take a while, because the installer downloads remote content.

segment.source: Create a provisioning package for certificates
segment.target: Create a provisioning package for certificates

segment.source: This example will demonstrate how to create a provisioning package to install a certificate.
segment.target: This example will demonstrate how to create a provisioning package to install a certificate.

segment.source: On the PC that had the Windows 10 ADK installed, open ICD and choose the New provisioning package tile from the main menu.
segment.target: On the PC that had the Windows 10 ADK installed, open ICD and choose the New provisioning package tile from the main menu.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: When the New project dialog box opens, type whatever name you like in the Name box.
segment.target: When the New project dialog box opens, type whatever name you like in the Name box.

segment.source: The Location and Description boxes can also be filled at your discretion, though we recommend using the Description box to help you distinguish among multiple packages.
segment.target: The Location and Description boxes can also be filled at your discretion, though we recommend using the Description box to help you distinguish among multiple packages.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Select the settings that are Common to all Windows editions, and click Next.
segment.target: Select the settings that are Common to all Windows editions, and click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: When asked to import a provisioning package, just click Finish.
segment.target: When asked to import a provisioning package, just click Finish.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: ICD's main screen will be displayed.
segment.target: ICD's main screen will be displayed.

segment.source: This is where you create the provisioning package.
segment.target: This is where you create the provisioning package.

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane, expand Runtime settings and then expand Certificates.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane, expand Runtime settings and then expand Certificates.

segment.source: Click Root certificates.
segment.target: Click Root certificates.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify a CertificateName for the Root certificate.
segment.target: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify a CertificateName for the Root certificate.

segment.source: You can set this to whatever you want.
segment.target: You can set this to whatever you want.

segment.source: For the example, we've used the same name as the project.
segment.target: For the example, we've used the same name as the project.

segment.source: Click Add, and an entry will be added in the left pane.
segment.target: Click Add, and an entry will be added in the left pane.

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane on the left, a new category has appeared for CertificatePath underneath the CertificateName you provided.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane on the left, a new category has appeared for CertificatePath underneath the CertificateName you provided.

segment.source: There’s also a red exclamation icon indicating that there is a required field that needs to be set.
segment.target: There’s also a red exclamation icon indicating that there is a required field that needs to be set.

segment.source: Click CeritficatePath.
segment.target: Click CeritficatePath.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify the path for the certificate.
segment.target: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify the path for the certificate.

segment.source: Enter the name of the .cer file that you want to deploy, either by typing or clicking Browse.
segment.target: Enter the name of the .cer file that you want to deploy, either by typing or clicking Browse.

segment.source: It must be a root certificate.
segment.target: It must be a root certificate.

segment.source: The provisioning package created will copy the .cer file into the package it creates.
segment.target: The provisioning package created will copy the .cer file into the package it creates.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Verify that the path is set, then click Export in the top menu and choose Provisioning package.
segment.target: Verify that the path is set, then click Export in the top menu and choose Provisioning package.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: You'll see a series of dialog boxes next.
segment.target: You'll see a series of dialog boxes next.

segment.source: In the first one, either accept the defaults, or enter new values as needed, and click Next.
segment.target: In the first one, either accept the defaults, or enter new values as needed, and click Next.

segment.source: You'll most likely want to accept the defaults.
segment.target: You'll most likely want to accept the defaults.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Click Next again in the security options dialog box, because this package doesn't need to be encrypted or signed.
segment.target: Click Next again in the security options dialog box, because this package doesn't need to be encrypted or signed.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Choose where to save the provisioning package, and click Next.
segment.target: Choose where to save the provisioning package, and click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Review the information shown, and if it looks good, click Build.
segment.target: Review the information shown, and if it looks good, click Build.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: You will see a confirmation dialog box similar to the one following.
segment.target: You will see a confirmation dialog box similar to the one following.

segment.source: Click the link under Output location to open the directory containing the provisioning package.
segment.target: Click the link under Output location to open the directory containing the provisioning package.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Copy the .ppkg from the output directory into the root directory of a USB drive.
segment.target: Copy the .ppkg from the output directory into the root directory of a USB drive.

segment.source: If it’s not at the root, it won’t be recognized by the device.
segment.target: If it’s not at the root, it won’t be recognized by the device.

segment.source: You’ve finished making the provisioning package—now you just need to deploy it to the Surface Hub.
segment.target: You’ve finished making the provisioning package—now you just need to deploy it to the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Create a provisioning package for apps
segment.target: Create a provisioning package for apps

segment.source: This example will demonstrate how to create a provisioning package to install offline-licensed apps purchased from the Windows Store for Business.
segment.target: This example will demonstrate how to create a provisioning package to install offline-licensed apps purchased from the Windows Store for Business.

segment.source: For information on offline-licensed apps and what you need to download in order to install them, see Distribute offline apps.
segment.target: For information on offline-licensed apps and what you need to download in order to install them, see Distribute offline apps.

segment.source: For each app you want to install on Surface Hubs, you'll need to download:
segment.target: For each app you want to install on Surface Hubs, you'll need to download:

segment.source: App metadata
segment.target: App metadata

segment.source: App package
segment.target: App package

segment.source: App license
segment.target: App license

segment.source: Depending on the app, you may or may not need to download a new app framework.
segment.target: Depending on the app, you may or may not need to download a new app framework.

segment.source: On the PC that had the Windows 10 ADK installed, open ICD and choose the New provisioning package tile from the main menu.
segment.target: On the PC that had the Windows 10 ADK installed, open ICD and choose the New provisioning package tile from the main menu.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: When the New project dialog box opens, type whatever name you like in the Name box.
segment.target: When the New project dialog box opens, type whatever name you like in the Name box.

segment.source: The Location and Description boxes can also be filled at your discretion, though we recommend using the Description box to help you distinguish among multiple packages.
segment.target: The Location and Description boxes can also be filled at your discretion, though we recommend using the Description box to help you distinguish among multiple packages.

segment.source: Click Next.
segment.target: Click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Select the settings that are Common to all Windows editions, and click Next.
segment.target: Select the settings that are Common to all Windows editions, and click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: When asked to import a provisioning package, just click Finish.
segment.target: When asked to import a provisioning package, just click Finish.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: ICD's main screen will be displayed.
segment.target: ICD's main screen will be displayed.

segment.source: This is where you create the provisioning package.
segment.target: This is where you create the provisioning package.

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane, expand UniversalAppInstall and click DeviceContextApp.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane, expand UniversalAppInstall and click DeviceContextApp.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify a PackageFamilyName for the app.
segment.target: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify a PackageFamilyName for the app.

segment.source: This is one of the things you downloaded from the Store for Business.
segment.target: This is one of the things you downloaded from the Store for Business.

segment.source: Click Add, and an entry will be added in the left pane.
segment.target: Click Add, and an entry will be added in the left pane.

segment.source: In the Available customizations pane on the left, new categories will be displayed for ApplicationFile and LaunchAppAtLogin underneath the PackageFamilyName you just entered.
segment.target: In the Available customizations pane on the left, new categories will be displayed for ApplicationFile and LaunchAppAtLogin underneath the PackageFamilyName you just entered.

segment.source: Enter the appx filename in the ApplicationFile box in the center pane.
segment.target: Enter the appx filename in the ApplicationFile box in the center pane.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Generally, LaunchAppAtLogin should be set to Do not launch app or NOT CONFIGURED.
segment.target: Generally, LaunchAppAtLogin should be set to Do not launch app or NOT CONFIGURED.

segment.source: Next, click DeviceContextAppLicense in the left pane.
segment.target: Next, click DeviceContextAppLicense in the left pane.

segment.source: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify the LicenseProductId.
segment.target: In the center pane, you’ll be asked to specify the LicenseProductId.

segment.source: Click Add.
segment.target: Click Add.

segment.source: Back in the left pane, click on the LicenseProductId that you just added.
segment.target: Back in the left pane, click on the LicenseProductId that you just added.

segment.source: In the center pane, you'll need to specify LicenseInstall.
segment.target: In the center pane, you'll need to specify LicenseInstall.

segment.source: Enter the name of the license file that you previously downloaded from the Store for Business, either by typing or clicking Browse.
segment.target: Enter the name of the license file that you previously downloaded from the Store for Business, either by typing or clicking Browse.

segment.source: The file will have a extension of "ms-windows-store-license".
segment.target: The file will have a extension of "ms-windows-store-license".

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Verify that the path is set, then click Export in the top menu and choose Provisioning package.
segment.target: Verify that the path is set, then click Export in the top menu and choose Provisioning package.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: You'll see a series of dialog boxes next.
segment.target: You'll see a series of dialog boxes next.

segment.source: In the first one, either accept the defaults, or enter new values as needed, and click Next.
segment.target: In the first one, either accept the defaults, or enter new values as needed, and click Next.

segment.source: You'll most likely want to accept the defaults.
segment.target: You'll most likely want to accept the defaults.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Click Next again in the security options dialog box, because this package doesn't need to be encrypted or signed.
segment.target: Click Next again in the security options dialog box, because this package doesn't need to be encrypted or signed.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Choose where to save the provisioning package, and click Next.
segment.target: Choose where to save the provisioning package, and click Next.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Review the information shown, and if it looks good, click Build.
segment.target: Review the information shown, and if it looks good, click Build.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: You will see a confirmation dialog box similar to the one following.
segment.target: You will see a confirmation dialog box similar to the one following.

segment.source: Click the link under Output location to open the directory containing the provisioning package.
segment.target: Click the link under Output location to open the directory containing the provisioning package.

segment.source: icd tiles
segment.target: icd tiles

segment.source: Copy the .ppkg from the output directory into the root directory of a USB drive.
segment.target: Copy the .ppkg from the output directory into the root directory of a USB drive.

segment.source: If it’s not at the root, it won’t be recognized by the device.
segment.target: If it’s not at the root, it won’t be recognized by the device.

segment.source: You’ve finished making the provisioning package—now you just need to deploy it to the Surface Hub.
segment.target: You’ve finished making the provisioning package—now you just need to deploy it to the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Deploy a provisioning package to a Surface Hub
segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package to a Surface Hub

segment.source: The following two methods for deploying provisioning packages apply to any kind of provisioning package that is being deployed to a Surface Hub.
segment.target: The following two methods for deploying provisioning packages apply to any kind of provisioning package that is being deployed to a Surface Hub.

segment.source: There is no difference in the way cert provisioning packages and app provisioning packages are installed.
segment.target: There is no difference in the way cert provisioning packages and app provisioning packages are installed.

segment.source: You may see different description text in the UI depending on what the package is for, but the process is still the same.
segment.target: You may see different description text in the UI depending on what the package is for, but the process is still the same.

segment.source: Deploy a provisioning package using first run
segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package using first run

segment.source: When you turn on the Surface Hub for the first time, the first run process will display the page titled Hi there.
segment.target: When you turn on the Surface Hub for the first time, the first run process will display the page titled Hi there.

segment.source: Make sure the settings on this page are correct before you proceed.
segment.target: Make sure the settings on this page are correct before you proceed.

segment.source: (See Hi there page for details.) Once you've deployed your provisioning package, the first run process will not return here.
segment.target: (See Hi there page for details.) Once you've deployed your provisioning package, the first run process will not return here.

segment.source: It will continue to the next screen.
segment.target: It will continue to the next screen.

segment.source: Insert the USB drive into the Surface Hub.
segment.target: Insert the USB drive into the Surface Hub.

segment.source: Press the Windows key on the separate keyboard five times.
segment.target: Press the Windows key on the separate keyboard five times.

segment.source: You’ll see a dialog box asking whether you want to set up your device.
segment.target: You’ll see a dialog box asking whether you want to set up your device.

segment.source: Click Set Up.
segment.target: Click Set Up.

segment.source: image with set up device message for surface hub.
segment.target: image with set up device message for surface hub.

segment.source: IMage
segment.target: IMage

segment.source: Click on Removable Media in the Provision From dropdown list, then click Next.
segment.target: Click on Removable Media in the Provision From dropdown list, then click Next.

segment.source: image with provision this device page for surface hub.
segment.target: image with provision this device page for surface hub.

segment.source: The available packages in the root directory of the USB drive will be listed.
segment.target: The available packages in the root directory of the USB drive will be listed.

segment.source: Note that you can only install one package during first run.
segment.target: Note that you can only install one package during first run.

segment.source: Select the package you want to install and then click Next.
segment.target: Select the package you want to install and then click Next.

segment.source: image with choose a package page for surface hub.
segment.target: image with choose a package page for surface hub.

segment.source: You’ll then see a dialog asking if it’s from a source you trust.
segment.target: You’ll then see a dialog asking if it’s from a source you trust.

segment.source: Click Yes, add it.
segment.target: Click Yes, add it.

segment.source: The certificate will be installed, and you’ll be taken to the next page of first run.
segment.target: The certificate will be installed, and you’ll be taken to the next page of first run.

segment.source: image with
segment.target: image with

segment.source: Deploy a provisioning package using Settings
segment.target: Deploy a provisioning package using Settings

segment.source: Insert the USB drive into the Surface Hub you want to deploy to.
segment.target: Insert the USB drive into the Surface Hub you want to deploy to.

segment.source: On the Surface Hub, open Settings and enter in the admin credentials.
segment.target: On the Surface Hub, open Settings and enter in the admin credentials.

segment.source: Navigate to System Work Access.
segment.target: Navigate to System Work Access.

segment.source: Under the header Related settings, click on Add or remove a management package.
segment.target: Under the header Related settings, click on Add or remove a management package.

segment.source: Here, click the button for Add a package.
segment.target: Here, click the button for Add a package.

segment.source: Click Removable media from the dropdown list.
segment.target: Click Removable media from the dropdown list.

segment.source: You will see a list of available provisioning packages on the Settings page.
segment.target: You will see a list of available provisioning packages on the Settings page.

segment.source: Choose your package and click Add.
segment.target: Choose your package and click Add.

segment.source: You may have to re-enter the admin credentials if User Access Control (UAC) asks for them.
segment.target: You may have to re-enter the admin credentials if User Access Control (UAC) asks for them.

segment.source: You’ll see a confirmation dialog box.
segment.target: You’ll see a confirmation dialog box.

segment.source: Click Yes, add it.
segment.target: Click Yes, add it.

segment.source: The certificate will be installed.
segment.target: The certificate will be installed.
